story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in the German countryside, there lived a kind-hearted little girl named Greta. Greta's greatest joy was spending time in the forest, exploring its many wonders and discovering the secrets it held.

One day, as Greta was walking through the forest, she stumbled upon a small, injured bird. Its wing was bent at an odd angle, and it was struggling to fly. Greta knew she had to help the bird, so she gently picked it up and carried it back to her home.

Greta's mother, a wise and caring woman, helped Greta tend to the bird's injury. They made a small nest for it out of soft cloth and fed it with seeds and water. Greta named the bird Ferdinand and promised to take care of him until he was well enough to fly again.

Days turned into weeks, and slowly but surely, Ferdinand's wing began to heal. Greta and her mother spent every moment they could with Ferdinand, teaching him how to sing and fly. It wasn't long before Ferdinand was strong enough to take to the skies once again.

Greta was overjoyed to see Ferdinand flying gracefully through the air. She knew he was happy and free, but she couldn't help but feel a little sad that he had to leave. Just as she was about to turn away, Ferdinand swooped down and landed on Greta's shoulder. He looked at her with his bright, shining eyes and let out a beautiful song.

From that day on, Ferdinand would visit Greta every day, singing to her and keeping her company as she explored the forest. And even though Ferdinand was now free to fly wherever he pleased, he always came back to Greta, the kind-hearted little girl who had saved his life.

And so, Greta and Ferdinand lived happily, surrounded by the wonders of the forest. They were the best of friends, and their bond was stronger than any chain.

As Greta lay in her bed, listening to the sound of Ferdinand's gentle song, she drifted off to sleep, feeling content and loved. And she knew that no matter what happened, she would always have a dear friend by her side.

The end. Gute Nacht, mein Schatz.
